structure.math
Class Mathematics

java.lang.Object
  structure.math.Mathematics

public class Mathematics
extends java.lang.Object

Class holding various useful mathematical functions.

Method Detail

sigmoidFunction

public static double sigmoidFunction(double x,
                                     double maxX)
Returns a value between 0 and 1 for x according to a bell-curved sigmoid function with x=0 having value 1 and x=maxX having value 0.

Parameters:
x - - X-value to which Y-value according to sigmoid function will be calculated.
maxX - - Normalization factor. Should be the maximum X-value for which meaningful Y-values should be calculated.
Returns:
For x <= maxX the sigmoid function value will be returned, otherwise 0.

xyz2rtp

public static double[] xyz2rtp(double x,
                               double y,
                               double z)
                        throws ConversionException
Converts Cartesian coordinates into spherical coordinates.

Parameters:
x - - X-coordinate of a point
y - - Y-coordinate of a point
z - - Z-coordinate of a point
Returns:
double array with 1st element being the radius, 2nd being the angle phi and 3rd being the angle theta.
Throws:
ConversionException - if an error occurs while converting coordinates.
See Also:
rtp2xyz(double, double, double)

rtp2xyz

public static double[] rtp2xyz(double radius,
                               double theta,
                               double phi)
                        throws ConversionException
Calculates the Cartesian coordinates out of a spherical coordinates radius, phi, theta.

Parameters:
radius - Radius
phi - Angle in the XY-plane
theta - Angle at the Z-axis
Returns:
double array with {x,y,z} and "0.000" DecimalFormat
Throws:
ConversionException - if an error occurs while converting coordinates.
See Also:
xyz2rtp(double, double, double)

distance

public static double distance(Point3d xyz1,
                              Point3d xyz2)
Calculates the Euclidean distance between two Cartesian coordinates.

Parameters:
xyz1 - Point3d object holding the first set of Cartesian coordinates.
xyz2 - Point3d object holding the second set of Cartesian coordinates.
Returns:
Euclidean distance as a double value.

getEulerRotationMatrix

public static double[][] getEulerRotationMatrix(double phi,
                                                double theta,
                                                double teta)
Returns an Euler rotation matrix to rotate an object in 3D-space by the angles phi, theta, teta. Z-axis points upwards. Y-axis points rightwards. X-axis points from the screen towards you. Equations 6-14.

Parameters:
phi - angle of rotation around z axis
theta - angle of rotation around x axis
teta - angle of rotation around z axis (again)
Returns:
Two dimensional double array [3][3] holding the rotation matrix.

length

public static double length(java.lang.Number[] v)
Length of an vector in a Cartesian coordinate system.

Parameters:
v - - Array of Number objects representing the coordinates in a Cartesian coordinate system, e.g. {x,y,z}.
Returns:
length of vector as a double value

addition

public static java.lang.Number[] addition(java.lang.Number[] vector1,
                                          java.lang.Number[] vector2)
                                   throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Sum of two vectors in a Cartesian coordinate system.

Parameters:
vector1 - - Array of Number objects representing the coordinates of the 1st vector in a Cartesian coordinate system, e.g. {x,y,z}.
vector2 - - Array of Number objects representing the coordinates of the 2nd vector in a Cartesian coordinate system, e.g. {x,y,z}.
Returns:
Sum vector with the same number of elements as vector1/2, with elements being double values.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if vector1 and vector2 arrays have different number of elements.
See Also:
subtraction(Number[], Number[])

subtraction

public static java.lang.Number[] subtraction(java.lang.Number[] vector1,
                                             java.lang.Number[] vector2)
                                      throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Difference vector between two vectors in a Cartesian coordinate system.

Parameters:
vector1 - - Array of Number objects representing the coordinates of the 1st vector in a Cartesian coordinate system, e.g. {x, y, z}.
vector2 - - Array of Number objects representing the coordinates of the 2nd vector in a Cartesian coordinate system, e.g. {x,y,z}.
Returns:
Difference vector with the same number of elements as vector1/2, with elements being double values.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if vector1 and vector2 arrays have different number of elements.
See Also:
addition(Number[], Number[])

multVectorByFactor

public static java.lang.Number[] multVectorByFactor(java.lang.Number[] vector,
                                                    double factor)
In/Decreases the length of a vector in a Cartesian coordinate system, by multiplying vector elements with factor.

Parameters:
vector - - Array of Number objects representing the coordinates of an vector in a Cartesian coordinate system, e.g. {x,y,z}.
factor - - In/Decrease vector by this number.
Returns:
Vector with in/decreased length and with elements being double values.
See Also:
invertVector(Number[]), multiplyMatrixWithVector(Number[][], Number[])

invertVector

public static java.lang.Number[] invertVector(java.lang.Number[] vector)
Inverting the direction of a vector in a Cartesian coordinate system, by multiplying each vector element with -1.

Parameters:
vector - - Array of Number objects representing the coordinates of an vector in an Cartesian coordinate system, e.g. {x,y,z}.
Returns:
Inverted vector with elements being double values.
See Also:
multVectorByFactor(Number[], double), multiplyMatrixWithVector(Number[][], Number[])

multiplyMatrixWithVector

public static java.lang.Number[] multiplyMatrixWithVector(java.lang.Number[][] matrix,
                                                          java.lang.Number[] vector)
                                                   throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Multiplying a vector with a matrix.

Parameters:
matrix - - Two dimensional array of Number objects representing a matrix in a Cartesian coordinate system.
vector - - Array of Number objects representing the coordinates of an vector in a Cartesian coordinate system, e.g. {x,y,z}.
Returns:
Inverted vector with elements being double values.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the number of matrix columns is not the number of elements in vector.
See Also:
multVectorByFactor(Number[], double)
